alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Franklin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 1:52AM EDT until July 28 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Dearborn County in southeastern Indiana... Northeastern Franklin County in southeastern Indiana... Southwestern Butler County in southwestern Ohio... Northwestern Hamilton County in southwestern Ohio... * Until 500 AM EDT. * At 152 AM EDT, radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Fairfield, Forest Park, Harrison, Bright, Ross, Taylor Creek, Dunlap, Colerain Township, Dry Ridge, Blue Jay, Skyline Acres, Monfort Heights, Williamsdale, Reily, New Haven, New Miami, Grandview and Millville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. To report flash flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
